definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: The pessimists proved the more prescient.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明，悲观者更有先见之明。

sentences.english: That is the true vision thing.
Indeed, we should note just how prescient the latter have been.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我们应该注意到，前者是多么有先见之明。

sentences.english: Three years on, Liu's vision turns out to have been true.
sentences.chinese: 三年以来，刘的先见之明变成了现实。

sentences.english: As head of the New York Federal Reserve, he was prescient about systemic risks to the financial system.
sentences.chinese: 作为纽约联储银行行长，他对系统性风险有先见之明。

sentences.english: Lamarck made an intuitive guess about the biosphere and again was prescient.
sentences.chinese: 拉马克凭直觉推演生物圈，而且具有先见之明。

sentences.english: That lack of prescience is hurting.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏先见之明，带来的是伤害。

definition: lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
predictable/sth one can predict without being a clairvoyant
to prophesy with supernatural accuracy (idiom)/to have an incredible foresight
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
quick witted/able to think fast in an emergency
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
